p: From March 2013 to March 31, 2017, there were a total of 298 H7N9 human infections and 112 fatal cases reported in the Zhejiang Province, China. There were 45, 94, 45, 34 and 80 cases identified from the first wave to the fifth epidemic, respectively. In each wave, 10, 39, 24, 13, and 26 fatalities were found, respectively, with significant differences among them ( χ 2 = 10.784, P = 0.029). There was no significant difference among the latest four waves ( χ 2 = 2.662, P = 0.447), and the significant difference at the 0.005 level was only identified between the first and the third epidemic ( χ 2 = 9.265, P = 0.002). The highest death rate was in the third wave (53.3%) and the lowest was in the first (22.2%). However, there were no significant trend in the death rate among the five waves ( χ 2 = 0.034, P = 0.854).
